title: Callum Hawkins all set for brutal conditions in Doha marathon after turning garden shed into a sauna
text:
Callum Hawkins has revealed he turned his garden shed into a sauna using Aldi heaters to prepare for the brutal conditions in the marathon on Saturday night.

The forecast is for 32C and 50 per cent humidity for the 26.2-mile race, which starts at midnight to avoid the worst of the heat.

The women's race last Friday turned into a farce with only 40 of 68 starters completing it and Hawkins detailed how he had prepared by running on a treadmill in his shed.

Callum Hawkins had turned his garden shed into a sauna to prepare for the conditions in Doha

He said: 'It's a big proper shed and not a wee tiny one. I've been getting the Aldi heaters in there. I got the temperature up to 39 degrees.'

Laura Muir will try to complete a golden hat-trick for British women — after Dina Asher-Smith and Katarina Johnson-Thompson — when she runs in the 1500metres final.

The women's 4x100m relay team of Asher Philip, Imani-Lara Lansiquot, Ashleigh Nelson and Daryll Neita qualified second fastest for Saturday's final in 42.25sec. Asher-Smith was rested and will return as she chases a third medal at the championships.

The men's team of Adam Gemili, Zharnel Hughes, Richard Kilty, and Nethaneel Mitchell-Blake — defending their 2017 gold — went through in a world-leading 37.56.
